alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 09 at 12:30PM MDT until May 14 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Cheyenne WY has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Wyoming... Little Snake River near Little Snake River near Dixon affecting Carbon County. For the Little Snake River...including Little Snake River near Dixon...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Little Snake River near Little Snake River near Dixon. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Major flooding occurs in the town of Baggs. Water is at the base of the Highway 70 bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued around 1030 AM MDT tomorrow.
